Class ZeRXconf

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class ZeRXconf
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the one entry point for the library.
    See Also:
    Advertising a new service

      • ALL_AVAILABLE_SERVICES

        public static final java.lang.String ALL_AVAILABLE_SERVICES

    • Method Detail

      • advertise

        public static rx.Observable<NetworkServiceDiscoveryInfo> advertise(Context context,
                                                                   java.lang.String serviceName,
                                                                   java.lang.String serviceLayer,
                                                                   int servicePort,
                                                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> attributes)
        This method is the one used in order to advertise the service on the network. As per default, this call will be executed on a proper Scheduler and return its result onto the main thread.
        Parameters:
        context - needed in order to retrieve the service for native API
        serviceName - the name of the service that will be advertised on the network
        serviceLayer - the type of service that will be served
        servicePort - the port on which the service will be available
        attributes - the additional attributes that will be passed from the server
        Returns:
        an Observable that will emit the NetworkServiceDiscoveryInfo as soon as the service is correctly started.

      • startDiscovery

        public static rx.Observable<NetworkServiceDiscoveryInfo> startDiscovery(Context context)
        This method is the one that shall be used in order to discover all the services available in the current network. By default, this call will be executed on a proper Scheduler and return the results onto the main thread.
        Note: as per API limitation, listing all the services available in the current network will not allow the components to resolve them. That means that you will have to call the startDiscovery(Context, String) on the specific protocol for having the data resolved correctly. If, when doing so you receive an exception from the android.net.nsd.NsdManager.DiscoveryListener, make sure you closed the previous Subscription before starting a new one.
        Note: this method is making use of the ALL_AVAILABLE_SERVICES constant to discover all the services in the available network
        Parameters:
        context - needed in order to retrieve the service for native API
        Returns:
        an Observable that will emit all the different services found on the current network

      • startDiscovery

        public static rx.Observable<NetworkServiceDiscoveryInfo> startDiscovery(Context context,
                                                                        java.lang.String protocol)
                                                                 throws NsdException
        This method is the one that shall be used in order to discover all the services available in the current network for a given protocol. By default, this call will be executed on a proper Scheduler and return the results onto the main thread.
        Parameters:
        context - needed in order to retrieve the service for native API
        protocol - the requested protocol
        Returns:
        an Observable that will emit all the instances of the service matching the given protocol found on the current network
        Throws:
        NsdException - if protocol equals ALL_AVAILABLE_SERVICES or the "_services._dns-sd._udp" value
